summary: 03/17/1993: A bomb exploded in Calcutta’s Muslim district, killing 86 and injuring 125. Two men were arrested in connection with the explosion.
addnotes: There were no links established with the Mumbai attacks earlier in the month, and one source believed it may have been an inadvertent explosion at a bomb-making factory.
scite1: Santosh Basak, “Huge Explosion Rocks Calcutta, At Least 60 Dead,” The Associated Press, March 17, 1993.
scite2: “Security stepped up throughout India in wake of bombings,” United Press International, March 18, 1993.
scite3: Krishnan Guruswamy, “Two Men Arrested in Bombay Blasts; Calcutta Death Toll Reaches 86,” The Associated Press, March 18, 1993.
